abstract: The big American power company agreed to acquire Kentucky’s two largest utility companies from E.ON of Germany for $6.7 billion in cash.
snippet: The big American power company agreed to acquire Kentucky’s two largest utility companies from E.ON of Germany for $6.7 billion in cash.
lead_paragraph: PPL, the big American power company, agreed Wednesday to acquire Kentucky’s two largest utility companies from E.ON of Germany for $6.7 billion in cash, Reuters reports. The companies, Louisville Gas and Electric and Kentucky Utilities, serve about 1.2 million customers and operate about 7,600 megawatts of electric generation.

headline.main: PPL to Buy 2 Kentucky Utilities for $6.7 Billion
